instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no chime no video
threads.message: This board turns on, no liquid damage or so. It wont chime or give image on screen or DP. 3V on LCD are present. I asume this is a dead PCH

<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no chime no video

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no chime no video
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no chime no video
threads.message:
[QUOTE="aprendiz, post: 4584"]USB activity??? Beeps without memory??[/QUOTE]
Beeps without memory, yes. And red light on external mouse. I forgot to mention all this before. Seems like the LVDS part of the PCH is k.o.???

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no chime no video
threads.message: So the boards works but there is no display. Is there 3V on <CAPACITOR>C9015</CAPACITOR> and <CAPACITOR>C9010</CAPACITOR>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no chime no video
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 4590"]So the boards works but there is no display. Is there 3V on <CAPACITOR>C9015</CAPACITOR> and <CAPACITOR>C9010</CAPACITOR>?[/QUOTE]

No 3V on <CAPACITOR>C9015</CAPACITOR> but 3V on <TRANSISTOR>Q9010</TRANSISTOR>. No <SIGNAL>LCD_IG_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> on <CHIP>U9000</CHIP>... and that comes from the PCH...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no chime no video
threads.message: Do you have video on external monitor???

[QUOTE="aprendiz, post: 5033"]Do you have video on external monitor???[/QUOTE]
Nope, i don't have

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no chime no video
threads.message: Do a PRAM reset, does it chime after? Disconnect battery indicator and check if <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> is high.
